summary: This is an email exchange between FBI personnel discussing the need for international travel approval to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation in London. The travel was originally planned for March 2020 but was canceled due to Covid-19, and the witness is only willing to speak at length in person.

persons.name: FBI Agent (CID/VCS)
persons.context: The sender from the FBIHQ Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit (CID/VCS) provides guidance on travel approval and cost estimates, noting they will be leaving the unit soon.

persons.name: FBI Agent (NY)
persons.context: The initiator of the email from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, seeking approval to travel to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

persons.name: Unnamed AUSAs (2)
persons.context: Two AUSAs from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) who were part of the planned travel to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Unnamed Witness
persons.context: An important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation located in London, who is not comfortable talking at length unless interviewed in person.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the 'Epstein/Maxwell investigation', indicating the ongoing legal case involving her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the 'Epstein/Maxwell investigation', central to the case.

connections.description: Planning to travel together to London to interview a witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
Seeking to interview the witness in person in London as part of the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
Jointly referenced in the ongoing investigation, indicating their linked legal case.

events.title: Planned London Travel Canceled
events.description: FBI agents and AUSAs planned to travel to London to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, but the trip was canceled due to Covid-19.

events.title: Video Interview with Witness
events.description: FBI agents briefly spoke with the important witness via video, but she is not comfortable talking at length unless it is in person.

events.title: Travel Approval Request
events.description: FBI personnel discuss the process and approval needed for international travel to London to interview the witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: FBI agents and SDNY AUSAs planned to travel to London in March 2020 to interview an important witness in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, but Covid-19 prevented the trip.
As of September 2020, the witness was only willing to speak at length in person, not via video, prompting renewed travel approval requests.
The correspondence reveals ongoing international investigative efforts in the Epstein/Maxwell case, requiring coordination between FBI field offices and headquarters.
Approval for international travel involved cost estimates and sign-off from division SAC (Special Agent in Charge) and IOD (Inspection Operations Division).
The FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit (CID/VCS) was involved in overseeing the travel request.
